issues.description: The ArrayHelpers method name is inconsistent between the template and other code. In the template repository ArrayHelpers defines appendElement(...), but Stock.java (template) and other classes (solution) call ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). The solution repository defines addElementToArray(...). This mismatch (method name/signature missing in ArrayHelpers) is a structural/template error that will prevent compilation and confuse students about which helper method to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the helper method name across the template and solution. Best fix: rename the method in template/src/.../ArrayHelpers.java from appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...) (keeping the same signature/behavior), so it matches Stock.java and the solution. Alternatively, change all calls to ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...) to ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...). Ensure ArrayHelpers exposes the same method name expected by other classes.

issues.description: The helper method in ArrayHelpers is named appendElement(...) in the template, but other template code (Stock.java) calls ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). The solution repository uses addElementToArray(...). This inconsistent identifier naming (appendElement vs addElementToArray) creates a compile/runtime mismatch in the provided starter code and forces students to resolve an unrelated naming error before they can work on the exercise logic.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper method name consistent. Rename the template method ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...) to ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...) (matching Stock.java usages and the solution), or add a wrapper addElementToArray(...) that delegates to appendElement(...) to preserve behavior. Ensure all references across template files use the same method name.
